newsitem.title: USA: Unison Healthcare named in lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Unison Healthcare named in lawsuit.

text.p: Unison Healthcare, which expects to restate its financial results for the nine months ended September 30, was named in a lawsuit alleging that the company, its officers and directors omitted material facts about its performance, law firms said on Friday.
The law firms accused the company and the executives of inflating Unison's stock price.
Representatives of Unison, which provides nursing care, rehabilitation therapy, pharmaceutical and other heath-care services, were not immediately available for comment.
The law firms of Berger & Montague PC and Bonnett, Fairbourn, Friedman & Balint PC said they filed the suit in the U.S. District Court for the District of Arizona.
The lawsuit was filed on behalf of shareholders who bought Unison stock between May 14, 1996 and March 10, 1997, the law firms said.
